util.runtime.jvm

Class ClassPathLocator

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.runtime.jvm.ClassPathLocator

  • public class ClassPathLocator
extends java.lang.Object
    Locates the base directory or jar file from which a given class was loaded.

    • Method Detail

      • findBase

        public static java.util.Optional<java.nio.file.Path> findBase(java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
        Attempts to determine the base directory or jar file containing the given class. This may fail for any of the reasons below:
        • This JVM doesn't have the "getProtectionDomain" permission.
        • clazz is not in a jar file or directory on the host.
        Note that this method also works if the class is in a jar file contained in another jar file and loaded through the Spring Boot class loader.
        Parameters:
        clazz - a class to determine a containing jar file or directory.
        Returns:
        an absolute path pointing to the class base location if the class could be determined to be in a local directory or jar file; an empty optional otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.
        java.lang.SecurityException - if a security manager exists and its the application doesn't have the "getProtectionDomain" permission.

        The following checked exceptions are rethrown as unchecked (i.e. the exception is masked as a runtime exception and thrown as is without wrapping it in a RuntimeException):
        IOException if an I/O error occurs when trying to locate the enclosing jar if this class is in a jar within a jar, e.g. Spring Boot self-contained jar.
